children.subject: cmon you're missing the

history.content:
If you enjoyed CS 70 and would like to continue working with the course, you can apply to be an Academic Intern (AI) for the Spring 2022 offering of the course:

https://forms.gle/LNJPuzA18CPw3GPSA

Serving as an AI for CS 70 is a great way to continue engaging with the course material and furthering your involvement with the CS 70 course staff. Many of our AIs continue on to be Readers and TAs for the course.

As a discussion AI, you'd help a TA with answering questions and facilitating discussion during weekly discussion section sections. Your weekly work breakdown is as follows:

2 hours: helping out in discussion (two 1-hour discussions per week)
1 hour: preparing for discussions

We may also hire office hours AIs, whose weekly work breakdowns would look as follows. We are currently unsure if we will hire any AIs in this role but we'll leave the door open nonetheless.

2 hours: helping out in office hours
1 hour: preparing for office hours (e.g. going over the week's homework/notes, etc)

You would be required to get 1 unit for being an AI.

Please fill out this form by midnight PST Saturday 01/15/2022.

FAQ

Is the AI position a paid position?

No. Unlike the TA and Reader position, the AI position is unpaid.

When will AI hiring be completed?

We plan on finishing up AI hiring by Saturday 01/22/2021, the end of the first week of classes, and we will do our best to communicate updates about this to all applicants.

Can I be an AI and a Reader simultaneously?

No. We want to offer as many students as possible opportunities to help with CS 70 and allowing students to hold multiple appointments on our staff would not be in line with this goal.

Will filling out the AI application affect my candidacy for the Reader position?

No. We plan on fully completing Reader hiring before we even begin AI hiring so filling out the AI application will not affect your candidacy for the Reader position in any way. And on the topic of Reader hiring, we hope to finalize offers by next week though we have been experiencing some delays from the department's end.

Feel free to ask any other questions in the follow-ups below and Happy New Years everyone!
